meanings.definition: In a truthful or accurate manner.
meanings.sent1: She veridically recounted the events of the day to her friend.
meanings.sent2: The scientist conducted the experiment veridically to ensure reliable results.
meanings.sent3: The robot claimed to be programmed to always speak veridically.
meanings.sent4: His memory worked veridically, like a perfectly tuned machine.
meanings.sent5: The GPS guided them veridically to their destination without any wrong turns.

meanings.definition: Based on or characterized by truth.
meanings.sent1: The veridically reported news was trusted by the public.
meanings.sent2: Her veridically written biography revealed unknown facts about the author.
meanings.sent3: The veridically painted portrait seemed almost lifelike.
meanings.sent4: His veridically honest nature made him a reliable friend.
meanings.sent5: The veridically blue sky stretched endlessly above the horizon.
